abstract: As big investment banks pull back, some lenders are bulking up in repo, a form of short-term collateralized lending that may carry hidden risks.
snippet: As big investment banks pull back, some lenders are bulking up in repo, a form of short-term collateralized lending that may carry hidden risks.
lead_paragraph: Regional lenders like Wells Fargo, Nordea and the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group have been bulking up in repo, a form of short-term collateralized lending that principally helps nonbank financial groups fund themselves and their clients. It’s not a wholly positive trend.

headline.main: Caution Needed on Push Into Repo Lending
